creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org
text:
I reused the Ant project's ReaderInputStream code for my own purposes, and in
writing some unit tests for it, I found a couple of bugs.

1) Calling stream.read(new byte[0], 0, 0) results in a neverending loop.  Easily
   solved by returning immediately if (len = 0).

2) read() returns the wrong value when the byte has the highest bit set.  Problem
   caused because (result += 256) has no effect, as result is defined as a byte.
   Redefine it as an int, problem solved.

Could you attach your changes in unified diff format?

Thanks,
Matt
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text: Fixed the issues, thanks for the report.
